p: Natural ecosystems –including frozen ones- are a vast source of genes, particularly resistance genes, some of which are supposed to be completely unknown (Wright 2010). In the case of glaciers, even the most pristine and remote have been shown to contain an astonishing amount of antibiotic-resistant microorganisms, able to thrive in vitro in the presence of high doses of antibiotics, once reactivated (Ushida et al. 2010; Segawa et al. 2013; Ball et al. 2014; Rondón et al. 2016; Tan et al. 2018; Rafiq et al. 2019; Ramírez et al. 2020).
